text: Inka Paqcha (Quechua Inka Inca, phaqcha, locally paqcha, waterfall,Yachakuqkunapa Simi Qullqa, Ayakuchu Chanka, Qichwa Simipi (Quechua- Spanish dictionary) "Inca waterfall", also spelled Incapaccha) is a mountain in the Andes of Peru, about high. It is located in the Ayacucho Region, Lucanas Province, Carmen Salcedo District. Inka Paqcha lies northwest of Inka Pallanka where the archaeological site of Quriwayrachina is situated.Investigación, Universidad Nacional de San Cristóbal de Huamanga, Oficina General de Investigación e Innovación, Vol. 18 Número 2 - 2010, p. 86, Ayacucho, Peru == References == Category:Mountains of Peru Category:Mountains of Ayacucho Region
title: Inka Paqcha
